intro: Cornutia pyramidata var. normalis, commonly known as the common cornutia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is native to regions of Europe and Asia, where it often inhabits woodland edges and rocky outcrops. The flowers are usually pink or white, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
